means: <正>（尤指言词）极无礼的，骂人的

sentence.Network_en: It is now freely applied as an adjective of an opprobrious kind.
sentence.Network_cn: 目前它被任意用作一种骂人的形容词.

sentence.Network_en: He ransacked his extensive vocabulary in order to find opprobrious names to call her.
sentence.Network_cn: 他从他的丰富词汇中挑出所有难听的话来骂她.

sentence.Network_en: One is the eulogistic word freedom, and the other is the opprobrious word chance.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个是表示褒义的词“自由”, 另一个是表示贬义的词“偶然”.

a court is not bound to credit bald assertions , unsupportable conclusions , and opprobrious epithets woven into the fabric of the complaint .法庭不必采信由枯燥的断言，没有根据的结论和无理的绰号所编织的诉求。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from late Latin opprobriosus, from opprobrium (see opprobrium)

means.word_mean: 2. (used of conduct or character) deserving or bringing disgrace or shame;
